articles.content:
Sister City Ties Established between DPRK and Mexico 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- An agreement on opening the sister city ties between Sariwon, the DPRK, and Rafael Lara Grajales, Puebla State, Mexico, was signed in Rafael Lara Grajales on April 13.
 It was inked by DPRK Ambassador to Mexico Ri Kang Se and Mayor of Rafael Lara Grajales Antonio Esperon Mora.

articles.title: S. Korean Labour Organizations on Victory in Election
Youth and Students Called Upon to Consolidate Victory in "General Election"
articles.content:
S. Korean Labour Organizations on Victory in Election 
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- The (south) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions in a statement on April 15 said that the Democratic Workers' Party owes its victory in the "general election" to all the people on this land including workers, peasants, the populace, intellectuals, youth and students, according to a press report.
 The statement said that the significance of the victory in the election to the 17th-term "National Assembly" lies in that it made a big rupture in the conservative forces' monopoly over the NA and the alliance dominated by them and provided a chance of turning the NA torn with political strife among corrupt forces amidst the politics-business nexus into a platform for new politics for the workers and peasants.    
 Meanwhile, the Federation of Korean Trade Unions in a commentary on April 16 said that the Democratic Workers' Party advanced into the NA through the election, thus realizing the people's desire to build political forces representing the labour movement and the progressive camp in south Korea

Yang Hyong Sop Meets Indian Ambassador e.p. to DPRK
    Pyongyang, April 21 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and conversed with Rich Pal Singh, Indian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
